poem:
**G20 Echoes**

Amidst the gathering  
of western tongues,  
a map of hope  
unspools,  
still waiting  
for hands to mold  
its promise.  
In whispers, the world  
leans close,  
holding breath,  
as the clock ticks  
toward peace —  
a future yet  
unwritten.  
Dreams linger  
like dust  
in morning light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US plan for Ukraine needs ‘additional work’, say Kyiv’s allies at G20 summit – as it happened 3.45pm GMT Closing summary The unilateral US plan to end the war in Ukraine “is a basis which will require additional work”, western leaders gathered in South Africa for a G20 summit said on Saturday. The leaders of key European countries as well as Canada and Japan said in a joint statement: “We are clear on the principle". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
